page.title: 08HOUSING:Cont
page.content: In the D-Block outside Stalham, there are just four telephone boxes, one Post Office, two small shops, two churches, six post boxes and one pub. Our house survey of this area revealed that only 37% of the houses had been built in the last 25 years and then not on estates: 23% built 1920-1960: 15% were Edwardian or Victorian and 25% before that. The present easily-observable trend of householders is to buy an old house or barn and then renovate it. In this way, many old buildings are being not only preserved but restored privately. The biggest implication of this increased mobility of population has been for educational provision in the area.
